title: Harrison Yongjoon Youn
text:
Hello! I’m Harrison Youn, an Economics PhD candidate researching Labor Economics, Health Economics, and Economics of Science and Innovation.
My work focuses on understanding how economic factors influence labor markets, health outcomes, and innovation processes. I’m passionate about using rigorous empirical methods to address important policy questions.
Explore my research →

title: Harrison Yongjoon Youn
text:
Education


 Ph.D. in Economics, 2028 (expected) The Ohio State University


 M.Sc. in Economics, 2020 Barcelona School of Economics (Spain)


 B.Sc. in Economics and Finance, 2018 University of Amsterdam (The Netherlands)

title: Harrison Yongjoon Youn
text:
Publications

Details about publications will be added soon. Check back for updates on my latest research!

title: Harrison Yongjoon Youn
text:
Research Interests
My research spans several key areas in economics:

Labor Economics

Understanding employment dynamics, wage determination, and labor market policies

Health Economics

Examining the intersection of health outcomes and economic factors

Economics of Science and Innovation

Analyzing how economic incentives shape scientific research and technological advancement

title: Harrison Yongjoon Youn
text:
Contact
I’m always interested in discussing research collaborations and opportunities. Feel free to reach out through any of the channels above, or drop me an email at youn.25@osu.edu.
Currently based in Columbus, Ohio
